title: HELLO AGAIN!
body_text:
I've heard your never-ending requests and felt your undying enthusiasm - here's your one and only chance to prove your passion!
After a lengthy absence, the famed "local phenomenon"
EastCoastDodgeball
invites intense dodgeballers and their beloved relatives and friends to the premier sports
and
family event of the summer,
Family Affair III
.
The History
It was the Spring of 2008 and I - "The Writer" - was in search for something fresh and exciting.
ECD
had witnessed plenty of firsts in its then two and a half year existence, but I was thirsty for more. I nestled the mouse to the keyboard and within a few hours, completed what would eventually become personalized paper invitations.
The next 30 days were a remarkably memorable time for the entire
ECD
community, with die-hard players and their loved ones eager and psyched for what awaited. On Saturday, May 31, the long, arduous journey to the inaugural
Family Affair
had finally culminated.
The spectacular athleticism of legends Megill, Wolf, Londono, and Edwards, the on-court antics of Mr. William Spengeman, the presence and enthusiasm of the adorable Tronolone sisters,
Family Affair I
was nothing short of amazing. Those who witnessed, whether as an active player or cheering fan, left for home with an irreplaceable smile.
The success of such an extraordinary event led to the sophomore family extravaganza,
Family Reunion
, in May 2009. Like its predecessor, it too greatly surpassed expectations.
Present Day
Now, in 2010, it is happening – again.
It's the unprecedented 3rd Annual extravaganza and
EastCoastDodgeball
wants you to be a part of it! Rejoin legends of the game as they showcase their athletic talents in front of an energetic audience comprised of beloved parents, siblings, and close family friends.
Please make every effort you can to attend this highly-anticipated, multi-hour spectacular only at the
Wall High School tennis courts
beginning at
6:30pm
. The entire event is cost-free; just bring a chair, a smile, and if you feel the uncontrollable urge, your "A" game. I truly hope to see you there!
-- "The Writer" --
body_html:
I've heard your never-ending requests and felt your undying enthusiasm - here's your one and only chance to prove your passion!

After a lengthy absence, the famed "local phenomenon" EastCoastDodgeball invites intense dodgeballers and their beloved relatives and friends to the premier sports and family event of the summer, Family Affair III.

The History
It was the Spring of 2008 and I - "The Writer" - was in search for something fresh and exciting. ECD had witnessed plenty of firsts in its then two and a half year existence, but I was thirsty for more. I nestled the mouse to the keyboard and within a few hours, completed what would eventually become personalized paper invitations.

The next 30 days were a remarkably memorable time for the entire ECD community, with die-hard players and their loved ones eager and psyched for what awaited. On Saturday, May 31, the long, arduous journey to the inaugural Family Affair had finally culminated.

The spectacular athleticism of legends Megill, Wolf, Londono, and Edwards, the on-court antics of Mr. William Spengeman, the presence and enthusiasm of the adorable Tronolone sisters, Family Affair I was nothing short of amazing. Those who witnessed, whether as an active player or cheering fan, left for home with an irreplaceable smile.

The success of such an extraordinary event led to the sophomore family extravaganza, Family Reunion, in May 2009. Like its predecessor, it too greatly surpassed expectations.

Present Day
Now, in 2010, it is happening – again.

It's the unprecedented 3rd Annual extravaganza and EastCoastDodgeball wants you to be a part of it! Rejoin legends of the game as they showcase their athletic talents in front of an energetic audience comprised of beloved parents, siblings, and close family friends.

Please make every effort you can to attend this highly-anticipated, multi-hour spectacular only at the Wall High School tennis courts beginning at 6:30pm. The entire event is cost-free; just bring a chair, a smile, and if you feel the uncontrollable urge, your "A" game. I truly hope to see you there!

-- "The Writer" --
